body.name: Murder by the Seaside: A completely unputdownable cozy mystery novel (A Grace McKenna Mystery Book 1)
body.description: “A super cosy mystery, best read on a Sunday afternoon with tea and biscuits” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“Glued to the pages... the last sentence in the book saw my jaw dropping!” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Portobello, Scotland. Grace McKenna is just back from a hearty breakfast at The Espy seaside pub when a perplexing mystery arrives at her door. Glamorous widow Sylvia Gordon is determined to find the truth about the death of her husband, Paul. Once a local celebrity with supposed psychic abilities, Paul is now the talk of the town after a deadly fall from the tower at a nearby college. The locals believe it was a tragic accident, maybe even a consequence of dabbling too deep into the psychic realm? But Grace has a feeling there's more than meets the eye…With the help of Tobias Sloan – a dashing English journalist with a keen appetite for mysteries – Grace starts unravelling the puzzle of Paul's last days. As she digs deeper, it becomes clear that plenty of people had reason to want Paul gone. Both his work and home life were rife with long-held grudges… was one of Paul’s trusted friends actually his murderer?Then, Grace’s search takes a frightening turn when another body is found – this time in the changing rooms of the posh local golf club.Uncovering a shocking secret linking the two deaths, Grace finds her professional and personal boundaries beginning to blur. She is left to face not only the ghosts of her own past, but also the prospect of a killer stalking the cobbled lanes of Edinburgh. Can Grace uncover the truth before another innocent life is taken?A totally unputdownable Scottish mystery, perfect for fans of Faith Martin, Clare Chase and Frances Evesham.What readers are saying about this book:"I freaking loved it... a seriously brilliant page turner that will have you hooked from start to finish." Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“I burst into tears at the end of the book; the scene was both shocking and so good! Murder by the Seaside definitely had me hooked, and I cannot wait to read more in the Grace McKenna series…I really liked this book, and I liked the author's writing style. I cannot wait for more books! A 5++ rating!!’ Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐"I absolutely loved this book. Kept me gripped on so many levels." Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐"I have not been so drawn into a book for a long time. So much so I sat up for two nights reading it." Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“I was hooked on this book from page one, and it never dropped me! A compelling, twisty story with rounded, believable characters and a plot that kept me guessing. Even the very last line of the book came as a complete - and fantastic - surprise. I can't wait to read the next thriller with Grace at the helm. Highly recommended!” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“I’ve found my new favourite series and I’ll be waiting to preorder the next in the series and catch up with Grace and the Gang.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“Loved, loved, loved this story. Cannot wait to see what happens next. Will recommend to others.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐“Glued to the pages... the last sentence in the book saw my jaw dropping! I can't wait for #2 in the hopefully not too distant future. Highly recommended.” Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐"This was a really cracking novel… a roller coaster of a ride." Reader review, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: What readers are saying about Murder by the Seaside
More cozy mysteries from Jackie Baldwin
Murder by the Seaside Murder at Castle Traprain Murder at Whiteadder House Grace McKenna Mystery series Book 1 Book 2 Book 3

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Murder by the Seaside gripped me from the first pages. From then, I read as fast as I could especially since Jackie Baldwin’s storyline moves quickly and seamlessly. The story never dragged or stalled in endless contemplation or dialogue. I love short chapters and she delivered! Being set in Scotland, I love learning about their culture, the phrases they use that are so different than Americans. Her cast of characters are likable or not, just as I assume she envisioned. This is a cozy, quick read that I loved devouring in just a few sittings. Luckily, I have her next book to dive into! I can’t wait since Baldwin left me a bit emotional at the end, having to take a moment to respect and love how she crafted the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: At first difficult to get involved, but as the plot became more involved and characters intertwined, couldn’t put it down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: PI Grace McKenna, takes on a case trying to prove the clients husband was killed and did not commit suicide. Her small agency of three people find clues that go no where. A spiritualist gives more clues and Grace’s former husband, a police detective becomes involved. If you like multiple twists and turns in a plot, tryout will like this story. Oh, and there is a surprise ending!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A likeable quick read!
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book very much even though there were some twists in the middle which eventually worked its way out. The really Big surprise was on the last page!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Murder by the Seaside
reviews.reviewText: This was an interesting mystery and kind of touched on a lot of different elements. Where should I start? Ok, we have Grace who was kicked off/quit the police force after the tragic death of her teenage son. She separated from her husband (as most often happens after the death of a child) and started a detective/P.I. agency in Edinburgh. Eventually Grace gets a case to solve the murder of a psychic who committed apparent suicide, but his widow thinks otherwise. This leads the whole team (of 3) at the detective agency into dangerous paths. More and more bad things happen as Grace infiltrates the Psychic college and her team infiltrates other areas. Dead bodies, theft at a country club, kidnapped babies, kidnapped adults, and dealing with the otherworldly via the mediums at the psychic college.Fun fact, psychic colleges are real. I thought it was a made up thing for the book, it’s not I googled it and there are real colleges out there for psychics and metaphysical studies which is interesting. This story has a lot of elements. The obvious one is the murder mystery, then we have the mother who is unable to move on from the death of her son and the murder case really brings that grief to the forefront. There are sections in the story that felt very repetitive, which may be because the case was going in circles but reading the same things multiple times, is not that fun for the reader.The narrator did a great job, the voices were not that different, but it was easy to follow along and she was able to convey the emotions of the scenes.This is a fun mystery with a touch of paranormal type elements (with the mediums). It is nice to read a story set in Edinburgh even if everyone is dying.I received this book for free from Netgalley and Dreamscape Media

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cozy mystery with an edge
reviews.reviewText: Grace McKenna has left the police force and started her own detective agency. She is hired to find out the truth about Paul Gordon's death. Paul Gordon was a psychic, well known and part of a College of Psychic studies. As the investigation progresses, Grace's undercover employee is put in danger when a woman is murdered. This story is full of lively characters and mysterious motivations. Is the college just a big scam? Was Paul murdered or not? Is the latest murder linked to Grace's case?So many questions and an enjoyable read to find answers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Great Surprise Ending!
reviews.reviewText: The book got better and better as I read. I don’t want to give anything away, but it reminded me of a play I saw recently where everyone had a part!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excellent 1st in a new series. I loved the protagonist. I could feel her angst, her pain and her determination. I liked the office of three women working together and that she was still on good terms with her soon to be ex-husband. I think that the author did an excellent job with her characterizations and it was a good solid plot. I definitely recommend this book for lovers of Murder Mysteries and especially those that are set in the British Isles. I look forward to book 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed the D.I. Frank Farrell series that Jackie Baldwin has written and so when I saw that she’d written a new series featuring a female detective, Grace McKenna, I decided to give it a try. I’m happy to say that I wasn’t disappointed. Grace McKenna is a very different character from Frank Farrell and with it being set in a Private Eye Agency it is not the standard cosy crime police procedural.Grace McKenna has had the worst possible year that anyone could experience, her son apparently took his own life, her marriage has broken down and she has left the police force to set up a private eye agency. Her two staff, Hannah and Jean are new to detective work and so Grace is also having to train them as well as work a very difficult and time-consuming case. At times the pressure and stress become almost overwhelming for her and her staff, but they persevere.I won’t give the plot away, but there are a number of twists and turns and more than one suspect. I liked the novel immensely and found it engrossing and one that I couldn’t put down. It gave a new angle on solving a crime, with at times rather unorthodox methods, that Grace hopefully wouldn’t have been able to use in her previous career in the police. Well done Jackie Baldwin and I look forward to reading the next novel in the series, Murder at Castle Traprain, which I believe is coming out in September 2023.

Loved, loved, loved this new-to-me author's cosy crime set in Scotland. Page turner with plenty of red herrings and strong characters. The ending was simply beautiful and exactly what I'd hoped. Cannot wait for the next in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: lots of twists and turns. worth a read
reviews.reviewText: The characters are all interesting and believable and plot has many interesting twists and turns. I loved Harvey, the dog and his vital part in all the proceedings.The main character was seriously assaulted in the line of the investigation but no mention of police following this up and she recovered "too well" and just got on with her work which was an unrealistic expectation.Also interesting because I viewed a top floor flat overlooking Portobello beach many years ago but never bought.I did guess the murderer early on but not the reason and intrigued how they were going to catch the person. Hence 4 stars.Looking forward to reading more books by Jackie Baldwin

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved Murder by the Seaside, the first novel in the Portobello Detective Agency series. Grace McKenna, her dog Harvey and two women sidekicks make a fabulous team.Grace is hired by a local resident to investigate the death of her husband. But all is not as it seems in this quiet seaside town. A young girl is murdered at a golf club and the local Psychic Development College comes under suspicion.It’s a super cosy mystery, best read on a Sunday afternoon with tea and biscuits. The setting, Portobello, could become the next Midsomer.. The characters, particularly Grace and her sleuthing team, shine off the page. It will keep you guessing to the very last page. There’s a real shock there too! I’m already looking forward to reading the next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have read all three of Jackie Baldwin's previous books, which were fantastic, but in my humble opinion this is even better. So well written and thought out and I just loved the new cast of characters. Have pre-ordered the next in the series and can't wait for it's release.
